dataset.title: City of Seattle Remote Watersheds Minor Hydrologic Basins
dataset.abstract: Hydrologic basins. City of Seattle Remote Watersheds, Cedar and South Tolt Municipal Watersheds delineated to the sub-basin or catchment level. Includes Major (SUBWAT) and Minor (CATCHMENT) basins referenced in the City of Seattle Habitat Conservation Plan. Includes basins from the Pacific Northwest Hydrography Framework Clearinghouse to the level of hydrologic unit code (HUC) 8 for some areas. City of Seattle remote watershed property ownership often shares hydrologic basins boundaries.
dataset.additionalInfo: Data presentation form - map.Other descriptive Information about the data set - HUC is the acronym for Hydrologic Unit Code (HUC). It is a hierarchical land area classification system created by the United States Geological Survey (USGS) that is based on surface hydrologic features in a standard, uniform geographical framework..

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: City of Seattle Cedar River Muinicpal Watershed, King County, Washington, USA

dataset.purpose: Cartographic and analytic. Defines overland flow catchment areas at varies levels based HUC basin schema. Includes basins used in the HCP in the Cedar. Fifty seven basins.

description.para: CalculateField CRW.BASIN_MINOR_BEEDLE SUBBASIN_NAME "Cedar River Above Landsburg" VB #; CalculateField CRW.BASIN_MINOR_BEEDLE SUBBASIN_NAME "Landsburg Drainage Subbasin" VB #; CalculateField CRW.BASIN_MINOR_BEEDLE WATERSHED_NAME "Landsburg Drainage Subbasin" VB #; CalculateField CRW.BASIN_MINOR_BEEDLE WATERSHED_NAME "Cedar River" VB #; CalculateField CRW.BASIN_MINOR_BEEDLE SUBBASIN_NAME "Cedar River" VB #; CalculateField CRW.BASIN_MINOR_BEEDLE SUBWAT_NAME "Lower Cedar River" VB #; CalculateField CRW.BASIN_MINOR_BEEDLE SUBBASIN_NAME "Cedar River" VB #
